name: Adaptability
effect: Adaptability increases the effectiveness of STAB moves from the usual 1.5× to 2×.
game_description: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.

name: Aerilate
effect: Aerilate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Flying-type, and increase in power by 20%.
game_description: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Aftermath
effect: If an attacker faints a Pokémon with Aftermath using a contact move, the attacker will lose 1⁄4 of their maximum HP.
game_description: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.

name: Air Lock
effect: Air Lock suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.
game_description: Eliminates the effects of weather.

name: Analytic
effect: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
game_description: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.

name: Anger Point
effect: Anger Point raises the ability-bearer's Attack to its maximum level - +6 stages or 4× usual power - when a move targeting it receives a critical hit.
game_description: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.

name: Anticipation
effect: A Pokémon with Anticipation will shudder upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in.
game_description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.

name: Arena Trap
effect: Arena Trap prevents opponents from fleeing or switching out. Raised Pokémon are not affected.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Arena Trap is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.
game_description: Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing.

name: Aroma Veil
effect: Protects allies from attacks that limit their move choices.
game_description: Protects itself and its allies from attacks that limit their move choices.

name: Aura Break
effect: Aura Break cancels the effects of the abilities Fairy Aura and Dark Aura and instead reduces the power of Dark-type and Fairy-type moves by 25%, for all Pokémon on the field.
game_description: The effects of “Aura” Abilities are reversed to lower the power of affected moves.

name: Bad Dreams
effect: Bad Dreams causes all sleeping opponents to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP at the end of each turn.
game_description: Reduces the HP of sleeping opposing Pokémon.

name: Ball Fetch
effect: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.
game_description: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle.

name: Battery
effect: Battery allows the Pokémon to raise the power of teammates' special moves.
game_description: Powers up ally Pokémon’s special moves.

name: Battle Armor
effect: Battle Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.
game_description: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Battle Bond
effect: Battle Bond causes Greninja to transform into Ash-Greninja when it KOs an opponent.
game_description: Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the Pokémon’s bond with its Trainer, and it becomes Ash-Greninja. Water Shuriken gets more powerful.

name: Beast Boost
effect: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
game_description: The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.

name: Berserk
effect: Berserk raises the Pokémon's Special Attack by one stage when its HP falls below 50%.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.

name: Big Pecks
effect: Big Pecks prevents the ability-bearer's Defense stat from being lowered, for example via Tail Whip.
game_description: Protects the Pokémon from Defense-lowering effects.

name: Blaze
effect: Blaze increases the power of Fire-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).
game_description: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Bulletproof
effect: Bulletproof makes the Pokémon immune to ball and bomb moves.
game_description: Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.

name: Cheek Pouch
effect: Cheek Pouch restores the bearer's HP when a Berry is consumed, on top of the berry's usual effects.
game_description: Restores HP as well when the Pokémon eats a Berry.

name: Chlorophyll
effect: Chlorophyll doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during bright sunshine.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

name: Clear Body
effect: Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
game_description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

name: Cloud Nine
effect: Cloud Nine suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.
game_description: Eliminates the effects of weather.

name: Color Change
effect: Color Change changes the ability-bearer's type, when hit by a damage dealing move, to the type of that move. For example being hit by X Scissor will change the Pokémon to Bug-type. Dual-type Pokémon change to single-types.
game_description: The Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the move used on it.

name: Comatose
effect: Comatose causes the Pokémon to behave as if it were asleep, though it doesn't officially have the Sleep status condition. It can still use its regular moves, but cannot be inflicted with any major status condition (sleep, poison, paralysis, burn, or freeze).
game_description: It’s always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up.

name: Competitive
effect: Competitive raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack when a stat-lowering move is targeted at it.
game_description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.

name: Compound Eyes
effect: Compound Eyes raises the ability-bearer's accuracy by 30%.
game_description: The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy.

name: Contrary
effect: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.
game_description: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

name: Corrosion
effect: Corrosion allows the bearer to poison any Pokémon, including Steel and Poison types.
game_description: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it’s a Steel or Poison type.

name: Cotton Down
effect: When a Pokémon with Cotton Down is hit by an attack, it lowers the attacker's Speed.
game_description: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.

name: Cursed Body
effect: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.
game_description: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.

name: Cute Charm
effect: If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability Oblivious.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is 2⁄3.
game_description: Contact with the Pokémon may cause infatuation.

name: Damp
effect: Damp prevents all Pokémon on the field from using the moves Selfdestruct and Explosion. It also prevents damage (to the Damp Pokémon only) from the ability Aftermath.
game_description: Prevents the use of explosive moves, such as Self-Destruct, by dampening its surroundings.

name: Dancer
effect: When another Pokémon on the field uses any Dance move, Dancer causes the ability-bearer to use that same move immediately afterward. They will still use their own move originally selected, at the usual time (e.g. after the opponent if they are slower).
game_description: When another Pokémon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed.

name: Dark Aura
effect: Dark Aura raises the power of Dark-type moves by 33% for all Pokémon on the field (not just the ability-bearer).
game_description: Powers up each Pokémon’s Dark-type moves.

name: Dauntless Shield
effect: Boosts Defense in battle.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Dazzling
effect: Dazzling makes the Pokémon immune to high-priority moves (i.e. those with a priority above 0).
game_description: Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.

name: Defeatist
effect: When the HP of a Pokémon with Defeatist falls below 50%, its Attack and Special Attack stats are halved.
game_description: Halves the Pokémon’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.

name: Defiant
effect: When its stats are lowered its Attack increases.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.

name: Delta Stream
effect: Delta Stream creates strong winds when the ability is activated (by Rayquaza Mega-Evolving).
game_description: The Pokémon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type’s weaknesses.

name: Desolate Land
effect: Desolate Land creates extremely harsh sunlight when the ability is activated (by Groudon reverting to its Primal form).
game_description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.

name: Disguise
effect: Disguise allows the bearer to avoid damage for one attack, in a similar way to Substitute.
game_description: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack.

name: Download
effect: Download raises either the bearer's Attack or Special Attack by one stage when switching into battle, base on the opponent's defenses.
game_description: Compares an opposing Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat—whichever will be more effective.

name: Drizzle
effect: Drizzle creates a rain shower when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.
game_description: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.

name: Drought
effect: Drought creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.
game_description: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Dry Skin
effect: Dry Skin causes several effects:
game_description: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves.

name: Early Bird
effect: The Pokémon awakens quickly from sleep.
game_description: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

name: Effect Spore
effect: Contact may poison or cause paralysis or sleep.
game_description: Contact with the Pokémon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker.

name: Electric Surge
effect: Electric Surge creates a low-lying electric field, like the move Electric Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep, and increases the power of Electric type attacks.
game_description: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Emergency Exit
effect: Switches out when HP falls below 50%.
game_description: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

name: Fairy Aura
effect: Fairy Aura raises the power of Fairy-type moves by 33%, for all Pokémon on the field (not just the ability-bearer).
game_description: Powers up each Pokémon’s Fairy-type moves.

name: Filter
effect: Filter reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.
game_description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

name: Flame Body
effect: If a Pokémon with Flame Body is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Flame Body (or Magma Armor) and a Pokémon Egg are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.
game_description: Contact with the Pokémon may burn the attacker.

name: Flare Boost
effect: Powers up special attacks when burned.
game_description: Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is burned.

name: Flash Fire
effect: When a Pokémon with Flash Fire is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.
game_description: Powers up the Pokémon’s Fire-type moves if it’s hit by one.

name: Flower Gift
effect: Flower Gift raises the Attack and Special Defense of all party Pokémon by 50% during harsh sunlight.
game_description: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies in harsh sunlight.

name: Flower Veil
effect: Flower Veil prevents ally Grass-type Pokémon's stats from being lowered, in double and triple battles.
game_description: Ally Grass-type Pokémon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.

name: Fluffy
effect: Fluffy reduces damage from contact moves by 50%, but Fire-type moves do double damage. Fire-type moves that make contact do regular damage.
game_description: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

name: Forecast
effect: Castform transforms with the weather.
game_description: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.

name: Forewarn
effect: Determines what moves a foe has.
game_description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.

name: Friend Guard
effect: Reduces damage done to allies.
game_description: Reduces damage done to allies.

name: Frisk
effect: The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.
game_description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s held item.

name: Full Metal Body
effect: Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
game_description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

name: Fur Coat
effect: Fur Coat reduces damage taken from physical attacks by 50%.
game_description: Halves the damage from physical moves.

name: Gale Wings
effect: Gives priority to Flying-type moves.
game_description: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is full.

name: Galvanize
effect: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves and their power boosted.
game_description: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Gluttony
effect: A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%.
game_description: Makes the Pokémon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual.

name: Gooey
effect: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
game_description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

name: Gorilla Tactics
effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.

name: Grass Pelt
effect: Boosts the Defense stat in Grassy Terrain.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat on Grassy Terrain.

name: Grassy Surge
effect: Grassy Surge creates a low-lying grassy field, like the move Grassy Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It restores the HP of grounded Pokémon each turn and increases the power of Grass type attacks.
game_description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Gulp Missile
effect: Gulp Missile is the signature ability of Cramorant. If Cramorant uses the move Surf or Dive, it returns with a fish in its mouth. If Cramorant then takes damage, it retaliates by spitting out the fish, dealing extra damage.
game_description: When the Pokémon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack.

name: Guts
effect: Guts raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack.
game_description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Harvest
effect: May create another Berry after one is used.
game_description: May create another Berry after one is used.

name: Healer
effect: May heal an ally's status conditions.
game_description: Sometimes heals an ally’s status condition.

name: Heatproof
effect: Heatproof reduces the damage taken from Fire-type moves by 50%. It also halves the damage from a burn, from 1⁄8 to 1⁄16 of the Pokémon's maximum HP.
game_description: The heatproof body of the Pokémon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it.

name: Heavy Metal
effect: Heavy Metal doubles the Pokémon's weight in battle. Increasing weight affects these moves:
game_description: Doubles the Pokémon’s weight.

name: Honey Gather
effect: Honey Gather has no effect in battle.
outside_of_battle: When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Honey Gather may pick up honey as a held item (if they are not already holding an item).
game_description: The Pokémon may gather Honey after a battle.

name: Huge Power
effect: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.
game_description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Attack stat.

name: Hunger Switch
effect: Hunger Switch causes Morpeko to change its form each turn, alternating between Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode. Morpeko's form also changes the type of its signature move, Aura Wheel.
game_description: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn.

name: Hustle
effect: Hustle increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Hustle is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
game_description: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy.

name: Hydration
effect: A Pokémon with Hydration will cure itself of any status conditions during rain, at the end of each turn. This includes self-inflicted conditions such as from using Rest.
game_description: Heals status conditions if it’s raining.

name: Hyper Cutter
effect: Hyper Cutter prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as Growl or abilities such as Intimidate.
game_description: The Pokémon’s proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

name: Ice Body
effect: A Pokémon with Ice Body will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during hail, after each turn. It also grants immunity to the hailstorm damage, if not already immune.
game_description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm.

name: Ice Face
effect: Ice Face is the signature ability of Eiscue. It allows the Pokémon to take a physical attack without taking damage. After the attack, Eiscue changes to its No Ice Face form, however, it can be restored in hail.
game_description: The Pokémon’s ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon’s appearance. The ice will be restored when it hails.

name: Ice Scales
effect: Halves damage from Special moves.
game_description: The Pokémon is protected by ice scales, which halve the damage taken from special moves.

name: Illuminate
effect: Illuminate has no effect in battle.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Illuminate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.
game_description: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon by illuminating the surroundings.

name: Illusion
effect: When a Pokémon with the Illusion ability switches into battle, it takes the form of the Pokémon in last place (6th) of the player's party. Illusion will not activate if the Pokémon in last place is the same species or is fainted.
game_description: Comes out disguised as the Pokémon in the party’s last spot.

name: Immunity
effect: Prevents the Pokémon from getting poisoned.
game_description: The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.

name: Imposter
effect: It transforms itself into the Pokémon it is facing.
game_description: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it’s facing.

name: Infiltrator
effect: Infiltrator ignores the effects of Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard. In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard, Toxic would still badly poison them.
game_description: Passes through the opposing Pokémon’s barrier, substitute, and the like and strikes.

name: Innards Out
effect: When a Pokémon with Innards Out faints, it deals damage to the opponent equal to amount of damage it took on the final blow.
game_description: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP.

name: Inner Focus
effect: Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.
game_description: The Pokémon’s intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.

name: Insomnia
effect: Insomnia prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep, both from moves by other Pokémon like Sing, and self-inflicted sleep like Rest.
game_description: The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.

name: Intimidate
effect: Intimidate lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle).
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Intimidate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.
game_description: The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat.

name: Intrepid Sword
effect: Boosts Attack in battle.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Iron Barbs
effect: When a Pokémon with Iron Barbs is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP.
game_description: Inflicts damage on the attacker upon contact with iron barbs.

name: Iron Fist
effect: Iron Fist increases the power of all punching moves by 20%.
game_description: Powers up punching moves.

name: Justified
effect: Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move.
game_description: Being hit by a Dark-type move boosts the Attack stat of the Pokémon, for justice.

name: Keen Eye
effect: Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.
game_description: Keen eyes prevent other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon’s accuracy.

name: Klutz
effect: The Pokémon can't use any held items.
game_description: The Pokémon can’t use any held items.

name: Leaf Guard
effect: Leaf Guard prevents the bearer from succumbing to major status ailments (sleep, burns, poisoning, paralysis or freezing) during sunny weather.
game_description: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

name: Levitate
effect: Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon).
game_description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

name: Libero
effect: Libero changes the Pokémon's type to that of its previously used attack.
game_description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use.

name: Light Metal
effect: Light Metal halves the Pokémon's weight in battle. Decreasing weight affects these moves:
game_description: Halves the Pokémon’s weight.

name: Lightning Rod
effect: Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.
game_description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Limber
effect: The Pokémon is protected from paralysis.
game_description: Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.

name: Liquid Ooze
effect: Damages attackers using any draining move.
game_description: The oozed liquid has a strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move.

name: Liquid Voice
effect: Liquid Voice causes all sound-based moves used by the Pokémon to become Water type. Water type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves.
game_description: All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.

name: Long Reach
effect: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.
game_description: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

name: Magic Bounce
effect: Reflects status- changing moves.
game_description: Reflects status moves instead of getting hit by them.

name: Magic Guard
effect: Magic Guard protects the Pokémon from indirect damage, including:
game_description: The Pokémon only takes damage from attacks.

name: Magician
effect: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.
game_description: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

name: Magma Armor
effect: Magma Armor prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like Blizzard.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Magma Armor (or Flame Body) and a Pokémon Egg are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.
game_description: The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen.

name: Magnet Pull
effect: Magnet Pull prevents Steel type Pokémon from switching out of battle or fleeing.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Magnet Pull is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be Steel type.
game_description: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from escaping using its magnetic force.

name: Marvel Scale
effect: Marvel Scale raises the ability-bearer's Defense by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep).
game_description: The Pokémon’s marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition.

name: Mega Launcher
effect: Mega Launcher increases the power of all aura and pulse moves by 50%. Heal Pulse boosts the HP restored by 50%.
game_description: Powers up aura and pulse moves.

name: Merciless
effect: The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.
game_description: The Pokémon’s attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

name: Mimicry
effect: Changes type depending on the terrain.
game_description: Changes the Pokémon’s type depending on the terrain.

name: Minus
effect: Ups Sp. Atk if another Pokémon has Plus or Minus.
game_description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Mirror Armor
effect: Reflects any stat-lowering effects.
game_description: Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.

name: Misty Surge
effect: Misty Surge creates a low-lying mist, like the move Misty Terrain, when the bearer enters battle. It protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions and halves the power of Dragon type attacks.
game_description: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Mold Breaker
effect: Mold Breaker prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Mold Breaker Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.
game_description: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

name: Moody
effect: Raises one stat and lowers another.
game_description: Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn.

name: Motor Drive
effect: Raises Speed if hit by an Electric-type move.
game_description: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Moxie
effect: Moxie increases the user's Attack one stage upon fainting an opponent.
game_description: The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.

name: Multiscale
effect: Reduces damage when HP is full.
game_description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

name: Multitype
effect: Multitype changes the ability-bearer's type if it is holding one of the Type Plate items. Moves of the corresponding type receive STAB.
game_description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the Plate or Z-Crystal it holds.

name: Mummy
effect: Contact with this Pokémon spreads this Ability.
game_description: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker’s Ability to Mummy.

name: Natural Cure
effect: All status problems heal when it switches out.
game_description: All status conditions heal when the Pokémon switches out.

name: Neuroforce
effect: Powers up moves that are super effective.
game_description: Powers up moves that are super effective.

name: Neutralizing Gas
effect: Neutralizes abilities of all Pokémon in battle.
game_description: If the Pokémon with Neutralizing Gas is in the battle, the effects of all Pokémon’s Abilities will be nullified or will not be triggered.

name: No Guard
effect: No Guard ensures that all attacks used by, and targeted at, the ability-bearer hit without fail.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with No Guard is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.
game_description: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.

name: Normalize
effect: Normalize causes all moves used by the Pokémon to become Normal-type, and attacking moves increase in power by 20%.
game_description: All the Pokémon’s moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Oblivious
effect: Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.
game_description: The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts.

name: Overcoat
effect: Overcoat makes the Pokémon immune to residual damage from weather conditions (specifically Hail and Sandstorm).
game_description: Protects the Pokémon from things like sand, hail, and powder.

name: Overgrow
effect: Overgrow increases the power of Grass-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).
game_description: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Own Tempo
effect: Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.
game_description: This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.

name: Parental Bond
effect: Parental Bond allows the ability-bearer to attack twice. The second attack hits with half the power, so in effect Parental Bond is equivalent to a 50% boost to all attacks.
game_description: Parent and child each attacks.

name: Pastel Veil
effect: Pastel Veil prevents the Pokémon and its teammates from being poisoned. It also cures teammates of poisoning when it enters the battlefield.
game_description: Protects the Pokémon and its ally Pokémon from being poisoned.

name: Perish Body
effect: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.
game_description: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.

name: Pickpocket
effect: Steals an item when hit by another Pokémon.
game_description: Steals an item from an attacker that made direct contact.

name: Pickup
effect: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again.
game_description: The Pokémon may pick up the item an opposing Pokémon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too.

name: Pixilate
effect: Pixilate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Fairy-type, and increase in power by 20%.
game_description: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Plus
effect: Ups Sp. Atk if another Pokémon has Plus or Minus.
game_description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

name: Poison Heal
effect: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned.
game_description: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned instead of losing HP.

name: Poison Point
effect: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.
game_description: Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.

name: Poison Touch
effect: May poison targets when a Pokémon makes contact.
game_description: May poison a target when the Pokémon makes contact.

name: Power Construct
effect: Power Construct is unique to Zygarde. When Zygarde 10% Forme or Zygarde 50% Forme falls below half HP, it changes into Zygarde Complete Forme.
game_description: Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes half or less. Then the Pokémon changes its form to Complete Forme.

name: Power Of Alchemy
effect: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.
game_description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

name: Power Spot
effect: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.
game_description: Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.

name: Prankster
effect: Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1.
game_description: Gives priority to a status move.

name: Pressure
effect: Pressure makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Pressure is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
game_description: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.

name: Primordial Sea
effect: Primordial Sea creates heavy rain when the ability is activated (by Kyogre reverting to its Primal form).
game_description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.

name: Prism Armor
effect: Prism Armor reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. It is not affected by the abilities Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze.
game_description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

name: Propeller Tail
effect: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.
game_description: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s Abilities and moves that draw in moves.

name: Protean
effect: Protean changes the Pokémon's type to that of its previously used attack.
game_description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use.

name: Psychic Surge
effect: Psychic Surge creates a low-lying psychic field, like the move Psychic Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents high-priority moves being used and increases the power of Psychic type attacks.
game_description: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

name: Punk Rock
effect: Boosts sound-based moves and halves damage from the same moves.
game_description: Boosts the power of sound-based moves. The Pokémon also takes half the damage from these kinds of moves.

name: Pure Power
effect: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.
game_description: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.

name: Queenly Majesty
effect: Prevents use of priority moves.
game_description: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon, making it unable to attack using priority moves.

name: Quick Feet
effect: Quick Feet raises the ability-bearer's Speed by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If paralyzed, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Speed.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Quick Feet is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
game_description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon has a status condition.

name: Rain Dish
effect: A Pokémon with Rain Dish will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during rain, after each turn.
game_description: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

name: Rattled
effect: When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).
game_description: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokémon and boost its Speed stat.

name: Receiver
effect: A Pokémon with Receiver will inherit the ability of a teammate in a double/triple battle when that teammate faints.
game_description: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

name: Reckless
effect: Reckless increases the power of recoil moves by 20%. By extension this means the amount of recoil damage taken will increase as more more damage is dealt (except for High Jump Kick and Jump Kick which have fixed recoil).
game_description: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

name: Refrigerate
effect: Refrigerate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Ice-type, and increase in power by 20%.
game_description: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.

name: Regenerator
effect: A Pokémon with Regenerator restores 1⁄3 of its maximum HP when switching out.
game_description: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle.

name: Ripen
effect: Doubles the effect of berries.
game_description: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

name: Rivalry
effect: Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.
game_description: Becomes competitive and deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but deals less to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

name: Rks System
effect: Changes type depending on held item.
game_description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the memory disc it holds.

name: Rock Head
effect: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.
game_description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

name: Rough Skin
effect: When a Pokémon with Rough Skin is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP.
game_description: This Pokémon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact.

name: Run Away
effect: Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap.
game_description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

name: Sand Force
effect: Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm.
game_description: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.

name: Sand Rush
effect: Sand Rush doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during a sandstorm.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a sandstorm.

name: Sand Spit
effect: Creates a sandstorm when hit by an attack.
game_description: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it’s hit by an attack.

name: Sand Stream
effect: Sand Stream creates a sandstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.
game_description: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

name: Sand Veil
effect: Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type).
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in a sandstorm.

name: Sap Sipper
effect: Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.
game_description: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Schooling
effect: Schooling changes Wishiwashi into its School Form, if its HP is above 25% and Wishiwashi is at least level 20. If its HP falls below 25%, Wishiwashi will revert back to Solo Form.
game_description: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.

name: Scrappy
effect: Enables moves to hit Ghost-type Pokémon.
game_description: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.

name: Screen Cleaner
effect: Nullifies effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil.
game_description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokémon.

name: Serene Grace
effect: Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance).
game_description: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occurring when attacking.

name: Shadow Shield
effect: Reduces damage when HP is full.
game_description: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

name: Shadow Tag
effect: Prevents the foe from escaping.
game_description: This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s shadow to prevent it from escaping.

name: Shed Skin
effect: The Pokémon may heal its own status problems.
game_description: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

name: Sheer Force
effect: Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects.
game_description: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.

name: Shell Armor
effect: Shell Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.
game_description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

name: Shield Dust
effect: Blocks the added effects of attacks taken.
game_description: This Pokémon’s dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken.

name: Shields Down
effect: Shields Down causes the Pokémon to changes its appearance and stats depending on its remaining HP.
game_description: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon’s shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.

name: Simple
effect: The Simple ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
game_description: The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.

name: Skill Link
effect: Skill Link causes multi-strike moves to always hit their maximum number of times. The moves affected are listed below; note that moves such as Double Kick that always strike the same number of times are not affected.
game_description: Maximizes the number of times multistrike moves hit.

name: Slow Start
effect: Temporarily halves Attack and Speed.
game_description: For five turns, the Pokémon’s Attack and Speed stats are halved.

name: Slush Rush
effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a hailstorm.

name: Sniper
effect: Sniper increases the power of critical hits by 1.5×. This means a critical hit will deal 2.25× normal damage instead of 1.5×.
game_description: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking.

name: Snow Cloak
effect: Snow Cloak raises ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a hail storm. It also gives immunity to damage by hail (if they are not already protected by being Ice type).
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Snow Cloak is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a hail storm/blizzard, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
game_description: Boosts evasiveness in a hailstorm.

name: Snow Warning
effect: Snow Warning creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition.
game_description: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.

name: Solar Power
effect: During harsh sunlight, Solar Power raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by 50%, but it also loses 1⁄8 of its maximum HP after each turn.
game_description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in harsh sunlight, but HP decreases every turn.

name: Solid Rock
effect: Solid Rock reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%.
game_description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.

name: Soul Heart
effect: Soul-Heart raises the bearer's Special Attack one stage when a teammate faints.
game_description: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints.

name: Soundproof
effect: Soundproof grants the Pokémon immunity to all sound-based moves, preventing all damage and effects.
game_description: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

name: Speed Boost
effect: Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.
game_description: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.

name: Stakeout
effect: Stakeout enables the Pokémon to deal twice the normal damage to any Pokémon that switches in or enters the field mid-battle.
game_description: Doubles the damage dealt to the target’s replacement if the target switches out.

name: Stall
effect: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
game_description: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.

name: Stalwart
effect: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.
game_description: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s Abilities and moves that draw in moves.

name: Stamina
effect: Stamina raises the bearer's Defense by one stage when it is attacked by any move.
game_description: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack.

name: Stance Change
effect: Stance Change is exclusive to Aegislash. When using a damage-dealing move, Aegislash switches to its Blade Forme. When using the move King's Shield, Aegislash switches to its Shield Forme.
game_description: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King’s Shield.

name: Static
effect: If a Pokémon with Static is hit by a move making contact, there is a 30% chance the foe will become paralyzed.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Static is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be Electric type.
game_description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis.

name: Steadfast
effect: Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.
game_description: The Pokémon’s determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Steam Engine
effect: Steam Engine raises the user's Speed by three stages when it is hit by a Fire- or Water-type attack.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.

name: Steelworker
effect: Steelworker increases the power of Steel-type moves by 50%.
game_description: Powers up Steel-type moves.

name: Steely Spirit
effect: Powers up ally Pokémon's Steel-type moves.
game_description: Powers up ally Pokémon’s Steel-type moves.

name: Stench
effect: A Pokémon with Stench has a 10% chance of causing the opponent to flinch when hit by a damaging move (provided the ability-bearer strikes first as usual).
game_description: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

name: Sticky Hold
effect: Sticky Hold prevents held items from being taken or switched.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Sticky Hold is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases.
game_description: Items held by the Pokémon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

name: Storm Drain
effect: Storm Drain forces all single-target Water-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles.
game_description: Draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk.

name: Strong Jaw
effect: Strong Jaw increases the power of all biting moves by 50%.
game_description: The Pokémon’s strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

name: Sturdy
effect: Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold).
game_description: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

name: Suction Cups
effect: Suction Cups prevents opponents forcing the ability-bearer to switch out or flee via the moves Roar, Whirlwind, Circle Throw, or Dragon Tail, or the item Red Card.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Suction Cups is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases.
game_description: This Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out.

name: Super Luck
effect: Super Luck raises the ability-bearer's critical-hit ratio by one stage (for most moves this increases from a 1⁄16 chance to 1⁄8).
game_description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.

name: Surge Surfer
effect: Surge Surfer doubles the bearer's Speed when Electric Terrain is active.
game_description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat on Electric Terrain.

name: Swarm
effect: Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.
game_description: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Sweet Veil
effect: Sweet Veil prevents this Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep, for example from moves like Hypnosis.
game_description: Prevents itself and ally Pokémon from falling asleep.

name: Swift Swim
effect: Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

name: Symbiosis
effect: The Pokémon can pass an item to an ally.
game_description: The Pokémon passes its item to an ally that has used up an item.

name: Synchronize
effect: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on.
game_description: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokémon.

name: Tangled Feet
effect: Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.
game_description: Raises evasiveness if the Pokémon is confused.

name: Tangling Hair
effect: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
game_description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

name: Technician
effect: Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%.
game_description: Powers up the Pokémon’s weaker moves.

name: Telepathy
effect: Pokémon with the Telepathy ability will not take damage from teammates in double and triple battles.
game_description: Anticipates an ally’s attack and dodges it.

name: Teravolt
effect: Teravolt prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Teravolt Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.
game_description: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

name: Thick Fat
effect: Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%.
game_description: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

name: Tinted Lens
effect: Powers up “not very effective” moves.
game_description: The Pokémon can use “not very effective” moves to deal regular damage.

name: Torrent
effect: Torrent increases the power of Water-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).
game_description: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon’s HP is low.

name: Tough Claws
effect: Tough Claws increases the power of moves that make contact.
game_description: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

name: Toxic Boost
effect: Powers up physical attacks when poisoned.
game_description: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.

name: Trace
effect: The Pokémon copies a foe's Ability.
game_description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon’s Ability.

name: Triage
effect: Triage increases the priority of HP-restoring moves to +3, when used by the ability-bearer.
game_description: Gives priority to a healing move.

name: Truant
effect: Truant causes the ability-bearer to only attack every alternate turn. On the even turns, it will say the Pokémon is loafing around.
game_description: The Pokémon can’t use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn.

name: Turboblaze
effect: Turboblaze prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Turboblaze Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves.
game_description: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

name: Unaware
effect: Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.
game_description: When attacking, the Pokémon ignores the target Pokémon’s stat changes.

name: Unburden
effect: Raises Speed if a held item is used.
game_description: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon’s held item is used or lost.

name: Unnerve
effect: Makes the foe nervous and unable to eat Berries.
game_description: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

name: Victory Star
effect: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.
game_description: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.

name: Vital Spirit
effect: Vital Spirit prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move Rest.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with Vital Spirit is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.
game_description: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.

name: Volt Absorb
effect: A Pokémon with Volt Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by an Electric-type attack, including Thunder Wave.
game_description: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Wandering Spirit
effect: Swaps abilities with opponents on contact.
game_description: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

name: Water Absorb
effect: A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.
game_description: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage.

name: Water Bubble
effect: Water Bubble reduces damage taken from Fire-type moves by 50%, and doubles the power of Water-type moves used by the ability-bearer. It also prevents the Pokémon from being burned.
game_description: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

name: Water Compaction
effect: Water Compaction raises the bearer's Defense by 2 stages when it is hit by a Water-type move.
game_description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.

name: Water Veil
effect: Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
game_description: The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

name: Weak Armor
effect: When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage.
game_description: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

name: White Smoke
effect: Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
outside_of_battle: If a Pokémon with White Smoke is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.
game_description: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

name: Wimp Out
effect: Wimp Out causes the bearer to switch out (or flee in a wild battle) when its HP falls below 50%.
game_description: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less.

name: Wonder Guard
effect: Wonder Guard prevents damage from direct attacks unless they are super-effective. Shedinja is the only Pokémon to have this ability so this means that only Fire, Flying, Rock, Ghost and Dark moves will have an effect.
game_description: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.

name: Wonder Skin
effect: Wonder Skin halves the accuracy of all status moves targeted at the ability-bearer.
game_description: Makes status moves more likely to miss.

name: Zen Mode
effect: Zen Mode changes the ability-bearer's form to Zen Mode when their health falls below 50%.
game_description: Changes the Pokémon’s shape when HP is half or less.
